website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight electric model packs a solid punch for its size. Contractors who do demo work regularly will appreciate this machine. Casual home do-it-yourselfers may still want to rent, not own.
pros: Runs on 110v current, no need for heavy generators for home projects
Set includes a number of useful bits and blades
cons: On/Off rocker switch poorly located, user must remove hand from handle
Too heavy for horizontal chipping work

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: This hammer was defective when delivered. When I first turned it on, it was delivering full impact force. After I made the first cement crack and attempted to make the 2nd crack, it lost impact force. I tried holding it vertically and in various positions but to no avail. I turned it off and back on. The same thing happened. I used a 10 gauge 50 foot extension cord. I don't think I did anything wrong.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Super product, which I should have bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to help make post holes in very rocky ground, after the post hole auger on the tractor was unable to get the job done. I had already rented a larger jackhammer and knew it would be to heavy to lift in and out of the holes. I was looking for something lighter, but could still get the job done. What is nice about this product is that it has turned out to be very useful on the farm, and I find myself using it far more than I thought. It comes in handy for breaking up concrete, trenching in our rocky soil and digging holes to plant trees. Everyone that uses it loves it.
customer_reviews.author: jfreischuetz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Out of the box it seems a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Out of the box it seems a little weak but once I read the manual it states it can take a few minutes to warm up to full hitting power. The anti-vibe feature is excellent. Me and my crew ran it for a week straight busting up a slab and everyone was pleased with the performance. Not as hard hitting as the bigger Brute unit but still a great tool for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am a general contractor and used Jack Hammer for demolishing 40 year old sidewalks using chisel point and digging french drains with clay spade. The Jack Hammer worked flawlessly for both tasks.
customer_reviews.author: malefic

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: one of the best bosch hammer breakers , love it
customer_reviews.author: Pawels

customer_reviews.title: If you need a Jack Hammer this is the one for any job
customer_reviews.text: The right size, the right weight and powerful. Comes with nice carryng case and one chisel Its a BOSCH, you can not miss You will enjoy the hard work
customer_reviews.author: RAFAEL FERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Best Jack Hammer, dont even think about it.
customer_reviews.text: I tested it against a Hilti that a rep was letting me borrow. This was more maneuverable and got the job done just as good (if not better) for a third of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Z13

customer_reviews.title: Got my job done.
customer_reviews.text: I dug a French drain 50 feet long by 3 feet deep IN PURE ROCK. This hammer worked flawlessly. It is the perfect compromise of tool weight, tool mobility and chisel impact.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K.

customer_reviews.title: Best demo hammer yet out of several we owned
customer_reviews.text: This is thecbestvdemo hammer we had so far. It replaced a Dewalt that failed after not much use- thing wasn't old yet failed on us. The Bosch works so much better- weighs less and gets more done. Love this one.
customer_reviews.author: kwb75

customer_reviews.title: Bosch 11335K jack hammer
customer_reviews.text: This jack hammer was well worth the cost it saved me hrs of labor cost by completing the project in half the time! It's a little heavy but performs like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome breaker hammer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Brute with this. Half the weight, double the power. Awesome breaker hammer.
customer_reviews.author: John McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there
customer_reviews.text: This is a little power house, not normally an electric demo hammer fan but this tool is well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: RRogers

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to dig fence post holes on my ranch in the hill country of central Texas where we have solid rock under 6" of dirt. The low profile and light weight makes it easy to get down deep into the hole and pull it back out again. Makes quick work of breaking up granite. NOTE: I purchased separately theand I find that I use this bit the most.
customer_reviews.author: Good2Go

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: NICE STUFF. CHOP A LOT OF 4" SLABS, DEMOLISHES IT LIKE ITS PLASTER.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: great demo hammer
customer_reviews.text: Jose from Ecuador I order this hammer on July 23 of 2012 and works great, I have rented this hammer many times and still working fine this tool really do its job. am very happy with this tool. if you are thinking in buying a demolition hammer, I can tell you this is a good hammer for you.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: 35-Pound works like 70-Pound
customer_reviews.text: While diging a ditch I ran into solid slate. Backhoe would not cut thru so I broke up the slate with this hammer. Not a toy, this hammer worked like a 70 pound but was small enough to work in a 12 wide ditch, 3 ft. deep. Finished my 70 ft. of ditch in about 4 days and the hammer didn't miss a beat! Worked it hard but it was childs play for this tool. Anti-vibration handle worked well. Great Hammer!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: yet powerful enough to bust through rocks like a game of Asteroids
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Oh heck yeah! Just light enough for me to thrown on my shoulder without being Arnold Schwarzenegger, yet powerful enough to bust through rocks like a game of Asteroids! Needed this for post hole digging in western Idaho, now i can mine-craft like a boss!
customer_reviews.author: TSC

customer_reviews.title: Godsend
customer_reviews.text: This has been a godsend as we live on the side of a mountain and any digging has been a real chore. Cut my husband's digging time for a rose planting from 3 hrs to 20 min. 5 of which were the actual digging the rest to remove the rocks.
customer_reviews.author: inphoenix

customer_reviews.title: all equipment is good guality and working out very well
customer_reviews.text: all equipment is good guality and working out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I should have got this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: William Moody

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We tried using it twice. It hammers for a few seconds then stops.
customer_reviews.author: Vernard Oliver

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: Great construction tool. It does its job quickly and I recommend it to my co-workers on site.
customer_reviews.author: O'Neil B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: Bosch has outdone themselves on this Baby , Lite with a lot of spunk so far (; Now I will work this baby pretty hard and post a reliability review In a couple of months................
customer_reviews.author: Nipper

product_meta.title: Bosch 11335K 35-Pound 1-1/8-Inch Jack Hammer Kit
product_meta.description:
The Bosch 11335K Jack Breaker Hammer delivers 22 Ft.-Lbs. of impact energy for the best material removal rate in class, impressive for a tool that weighs just 38 Lbs. Providing 1,300 BPM, this 15.0 Amp tool has all-metal housing, metal tube and case, and it can handle heavy-duty applications such as outdoor asphalt work or indoor foundation removal. It has a Vibration Control system, which includes a longer air cushion in the hammer mechanism and a shock-reducing top handle. This tool has a two-way tool retainer that accepts standard 1-1/8- In. hex, air tool steel with retaining collar or Bosch internal-locking combo steel. The breaker hammer with included carrying case with wheels is fully mobile, and it has Service Minderbrushes for preventative maintenance reminders.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Bosch 11335K 35-Pound 1-1/8-Inch Jack Hammer Kit. Grease-packed gearbox and hammer mechanism – smooth and robust operation
feature_bullets: Power-to-weight ratio – 22 Ft.-Lbs. of impact force at 38 Lbs. of weight for great removal rate
Vibration Control technology – shock reduction in hammer mechanism and at handle
360° articulating auxiliary handle – versatile placement for greater operator control
In-line design – tool balance controls angled, horizontal and vertical applications
Versatile two-way bit retention – accepts Bosch 1-1/8-In. hex steel and standard 1-1/8-In. air stee
Carrying case with wheels – convenient storage and easy transportation
All-metal housing, metal tube and case — designed for great jobsite durability
Service Minderbrush system – shuts tool down when maintenance is required
